definitions.definition: A paragraph or section of text or music with particular meaning.
definitions.example: She struggled to play the difficult passages.

definitions.definition: Part of a path or journey.
definitions.example: He made his passage through the trees carefully, mindful of the stickers.

definitions.definition: The official approval of a bill or act by a parliament.
definitions.example: The company was one of the prime movers in lobbying for the passage of the act.

definitions.definition: The use of tight brushwork to link objects in separate spatial plains. Commonly seen in Cubist works.
An underground cavity, formed by water or falling rocks, which is much longer than it is wide.
The act of passing; movement across or through.
The right to pass from one place to another.
A fee paid for passing or for being conveyed between places.
Serial passage, a technique used in bacteriology and virology
A gambling game for two players using three dice, in which the object is to throw a double over ten.
To pass something, such as a pathogen or stem cell, through a host or medium
definitions.example: After 24 hours, the culture was passaged to an agar plate.

definitions.definition: To make a passage, especially by sea; to cross
A movement in classical dressage, in which the horse performs a very collected, energetic, and elevated trot that has a longer period of suspension between each foot fall than a working trot.
